events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred last night involving a collision with a street pole.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the case and to coordinate communication with the claimant.
The customer received formal acknowledgement of their auto accident claim and next steps were outlined.
The claimant was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report from the accident scene.
All required documents including the police report and multiple images of the vehicle damage were received.
The investigation process began to verify the details around the car collision and assess the damage.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of the accident circumstances and validation of the claim.
A settlement offer covering all repairs and towing fees was proposed to the claimant for approval.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount.
The auto accident claim was officially approved by the claims department after acceptance by the customer.
The payment for the agreed settlement amount was issued and transferred to the claimant's bank account.
Following payment issuance, the claim case was closed with all obligations completed successfully.
The auto accident claim files were archived for record-keeping and potential future reference purposes.
